title: Why are 4 AD team comps + support OK?!
body:
Seriously this is the most toxic bullshit i've ever seen and riot seems to be brushing it off like it's not a big deal

IT'S A PROBLEM

replies.body:
Clearly, we need a fifth AD on these teams.

{{champion:22}} It's my time to shine.

Play someone that jumps on them. I've been palying with 3 marksmen and their enemy has khazis and akali. All they had to do is engage at the same time and marksmen collapsed. I'd say 3 assassins + support vs 3 marksmens + support, the assassins would most likely win.

congrats the champion pool has effectively been reduced to nothing buy armor tanks and assassins, because you either need to have an answer to these "fighters" which just assassinate anyone who isn't a tank, or the overwhelming scaling and utility of marksmen after the rework. 

Riot completely failed to utilize resources as gating tools to power on most every AD champion, but treats it as a core mechanic of many of the AP champions, and yet offers a pitiful number of items. Then gives out the "magic" stat of CDR out on purely AD items.

AD champions can utilize every stat, shy of AP and Mana in the game to a decently valid extent. While AP champions try to scrape together 40% CDR, and build items which offer no combat advantage, only allow you to use more skills. Yet AP skills really don't have any higher base damage than AD skills, yet they on average have higher costs and longer CDs

khazix can but unfortunately for akali, she can only all-in one target and all of her damage except for base auto attack damage is magic damage

another problem is that many assassins have horrible laning phases and should say the support, jungler or top be tanks, they can lock down the assassins as they attempt damage
unless they're zed, in which case they have better waveclear than most mages.
and also equally powerful mobility as {{champion:7}}, if not stronger
no one has more mobility than leblanc...but she is mana gated and relies heavily on magic penetration combined with burst damage and sheer AP while also being one of the riskiest assassins to play as
i know, but the point was that he has 3 dashes instead of 4, but she only gets 4 if she uses her ult for the extra dash, he always get 3.
true, but leblanc's is up every few seconds instead of  about a dozen

True, but zed's ult has a much longer range which he can reactivate it.

Oh yeah, and it's a teleport not a dash, so it's also just slightly stronger. Instant>fast

It really is dumb lol, I recently saw a post like this get 200+ thumbs up 2 days ago. AD mids like {{champion:238}} {{champion:157}}  so common now. They have better siege, better mobility to roam, better items (cough* {{item:3147}} {{item:3155}} for cheap). From what I recall of the post, it said something about 'mage items costing too much compared to ad mid items, and the power scale on ad mids are quicker because of that. By the time a mid gets 1000 ap, its like having 500 ap because of resists and super tanks with damage reduction.'

I was there for that post actually. The guy had a decent point. Almost every Core AP Item is over 3k+ now except for Void Staff being 2.8k. People who may argue that Mages have easy farming/waveclear can justify the prices but, then we have Zed and Yasuo who can also easily farm and waveclear at High Elo. {{item:3155}} is only 1300 gold. This item built into Maw is way too gold efficient. It offers 3 types of stats for only 1300g. 1 offensive stat AD, 1 defensive stat MR, and on top of that a magic shield. This magic shield is then quantified by NOT ONLY the magic resist on the item, but also the magic resist blue runes people usually take mid/top/ad/supp/.... everywhere. Building {{item:3191}}  doesn't cut it anymore. If I were to put a Zed/Yasuo with Hexblade vs any mage with the Seeker equivalent, I gurantee the Zed/Yasuo would be way more favorable to win.

One, Void Staff is 2650, not 2800.

Two, we have another AP item that's sub 3k gold.
{{item:3124}}  #kappa

> [{quoted}](name=0Relm0,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O1AYhOJl,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2016-03-29T08:21:50.017+0000)
>
> One, Void Staff is 2650, not 2800.
> 
> Two, we have another AP item that's sub 3k gold.
> {{item:3124}}  #kappa

don't forget abyssal scepter, which is 2350 gold
This is more about the mages who stay back from a range. Things like Xerath or Velkoz, who really don't benefit from that passive.

> [{quoted}](name=B1naryB0t,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O1AYhOJl,comment-id=00020000000100000000,timestamp=2016-03-29T15:37:51.370+0000)
>
> This is more about the mages who stay back from a range. Things like Xerath or Velkoz, who really don't benefit from that passive.

fair enough.  it's really strong on low range AP champions though
I've beaten a Zed as Ahri.....and I've actually won my lane against them as Azir, Syndra, Heimer, Zyra, Lux,  shall i keep going??? XD
So what quality players are you going up against?

Hexdrinker vs Seeker's Armguard really shows the difference in AP vs AD.

Hexdrinker is, quite simply, a _far_ more effective item than Seeker's is.
I feel the only reason Zhonya's is expensive is because it's godly in coordinated team comps, otherwise it's really bad, and this is not a good thing.
Meddler said that the price tag is for the active (which it's a powerful active, no doubt) but the issue then becomes that it's the only viable AP + Armor item.
Lol at trying to say Zed and Yasuo have better seige than AP mids.
while their siege power is up for debate, they do objectively have higher tower damage.

Any champion who is AD almost automatically has higher tower damage than AP champions (with few exceptions), that's just a trait of the whole system. Just because they have high tower damage though doesn't mean they siege well. Zed and Yasuo are both squishy, and worst of all, are both melee. Yasuo can't even poke. I can see why Zed has decent siege because of poke, but mages do poke and zoning better **_overall_** (not saying in all cases, just in a general sense) compared to most AD.
Because armor is dirt cheap.

If only it mattered. You can buy armor all you want, but armor is really only very useful if you've got a decent amount of health to back it up. Except that if you're going to build armor and hp, then you're skipping out on buying damage. So if you're ignoring damage, then you can't every hope to kill the enemy unless they massively misplay. 

On top of that, it's assuming that you don't need to purchase mana or mana regen, while the enemy AD champion probably has no mana or their mana gating is so absent that half of them almost minds well be resourceless. If nothing else, remember that if you're mana gated, it ALWAYS costs you a resource to deal any meaningful damage if you're not AD.

So awesome, i'll just buy the dirt cheap armor to counter the enemy's AD (which they are building almost exclusively), i'll just add it in between my mana and health, while also remembering to grap enough AP so that my damage stays threatening.

So true lol. So many AD Champs practically have no mana bar like {{champion:266}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:238}} and thats me probably missing 2 or 3 more. Base Energy regens significantly quicker than Base Mana. They don't even have to worry about Mana items. They can just rush {{item:3155}}.

 Most mages have to worry about Health, Ability Power, Magic Pen, Mana/Mana Regen, Cooldown Reduction, Armor/Resists.

AD Mids like {{champion:238}} {{champion:157}} don't need to worry about Mana. They can just spam skills as much as they want. 

I mean what truly is the Mage counterpart to {{item:3155}} ? {{item:3191}}  doesn't offer a shield at low HP that is quantified by the Armor on the item AND the base Armor/Runes. Definitely can't be {{item:3136}}. Let's be real now, this offers absolutely no armor or shield AND costs 300g more than Hex.

Not to mention AD Champions have SIGNIFICANTLY stronger Auto Attacks because of the AD Items. AP Items hardly increase a Mages Autos. AD Champs siege quicker and when both the AD and AP Champs use all their Cooldowns, the AD Champion can still Auto Attack.

Hell even the Starter items for AD/AP Midlaners are biased.

Look at {{item:1056}} , it offers NO spellvamp. It offers Mana Regen because Mages are typically dependant on this secondary resource to either push/poke/all-in.

Now look at the infamous {{item:1055}} . This offers Lifesteal, because let's be real Zed and Yasuo don't use Mana. So even if a Zed/Yasuo starts playing really safe after you win a trade against them, they can just farm jungle camps, crab, or minions to lifesteal undo the whole process, which ultimately means longer lanephase or even earlier roaming.

I've been in countless cases where Dorans Blade 1 potion would outsustain a Dorans Ring 2 potion scenario. It's just WAY more cost effective to play AD Mids, almost forced in high elo.

Dorans Blade can potentially lifesteal a Zed/Yasuo mid up to 5-10 Health Potions, not to mention they don't even need Mana so they can spam abilities/poke/push/siege at free will. A LOT more than what a Dorans Ring can offer.

Not to mention, now with {{item:3147}} , Every AD champion who builds it INCLUDING {{champion:238}} , now gets a Mini-zed ulti bonus to finish off when you flee the scene. Mages don't have an item that can do this. {{item:3151}} does like almost nothing at low Health. {{item:3285}} I can only see this being a finisher with combinations of Ignite + DoT from {{champion:69}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:90}}  or other AP chamions with DoT.

Let's be real again though, that's not going to finish an AD Champion who rushes {{item:3155}} . The shield auto-procs, it doesn't need to be skillfully activated. It doesn't forget to proc when the user is low on Health. It's way too cost effective and easy to obtain. Nearly every high elo game I've played, everyone rushes it. Hell I've even seen some Mages rush this item because of how cost effective it is. That shouldn't even be a thing...
deathfires grasp though

> [{quoted}](name=The Voids Call,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O1AYhOJl,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2016-03-29T02:15:42.397+0000)
>
> If only it mattered. You can buy armor all you want, but armor is really only very useful if you've got a decent amount of health to back it up. Except that if you're going to build armor and hp, then you're skipping out on buying damage. So if you're ignoring damage, then you can't every hope to kill the enemy unless they massively misplay. 
> 
> On top of that, it's assuming that you don't need to purchase mana or mana regen, while the enemy AD champion probably has no mana or their mana gating is so absent that half of them almost minds well be resourceless. If nothing else, remember that if you're mana gated, it ALWAYS costs you a resource to deal any meaningful damage if you're not AD.
> 
> So awesome, i'll just buy the dirt cheap armor to counter the enemy's AD (which they are building almost exclusively), i'll just add it in between my mana and health, while also remembering to grap enough AP so that my damage stays threatening.

rod of ages + zhonya's.  i know that it's expensive, but it will help a lot.  the real problem isn't maw or hexdrinker, it's the fact that sterak's is good on champions that aren't bruisers or tanks, it's good on adcs and ad assassins as well.  this is the real issue.  zhonya's active counters so much that it has to be gated behind such a large price.  the only problem is the build path that doesn't help much against ad assassin mid laners like zed

except AD has the natural early game advantage already. 
So only having items which take effect in the mid-late game and only make you decently tanky against the champions who have already been shutting you down in lane in the early-mid game, just compounds the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=The Voids Call,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O1AYhOJl,comment-id=0006000000010000,timestamp=2016-03-29T16:31:17.628+0000)
>
> except AD has the natural early game advantage already. 
> So only having items which take effect in the mid-late game and only make you decently tanky against the champions who have already been shutting you down in lane in the early-mid game, just compounds the problem.

i always thought ap was supposed to be stronger early due to generally being more bursty while ad is supposed to be more dps, but that has been unfortunately changed due to itemization reworks

Trust me. Thats my to go item on almost all tank mages (sometimes adding Abyssal). And yet, there's no variation, its hella expensive thanks to Zhonyas, and I can't buy a lot of cool tank items like Sunfire or Frozen Heart because it doesn't synergize to my tanky mage pattern .  It just ends up becoming a way to reduce my damage with little benefit.

I'm honestly hoping that Riot sticks to the idea of making mana more prevalent in itemization.

> [{quoted}](name=Samflash3,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O1AYhOJl,comment-id=0006000000010001,timestamp=2016-03-29T18:25:02.364+0000)
>
> Trust me. Thats my to go item on almost all tank mages (sometimes adding Abyssal). And yet, there's no variation, its hella expensive thanks to Zhonyas, and I can't buy a lot of cool tank items like Sunfire or Frozen Heart because it doesn't synergize to my tanky mage pattern .  It just ends up becoming a way to reduce my damage with little benefit.
> 
> I'm honestly hoping that Riot sticks to the idea of making mana more prevalent in itemization.

i believe riot did say they want to make mana more of a mage stat and mana regen more of a support stat, and that morello was going to get mana.  if they start shifting the itemization to mana, that might make items like archangel's stronger, and maybe make items like frozen heart stronger for mages as well.  it seems there aren't really any ap bruiser options to be able to build a bit of defense without giving too much damage.  at the same time, i don't really know that it's good to make bruisers too strong, and they should probably be nerfing the ability of non bruisers to build as such (i.e. assassins, ADCs)

Why is support specifically pointed out? AD support can do dmg too, so it should be 5 AD team comp instead !

...? No AD support? {{champion:48}}

because it's the only position which you wouldn't regularly expect an AD champion to be playing. I'm not saying it doesn't happen, but even then most supports don't build AP. Most just build utility or tank.
support vayne, doesn't require damage items because max health% true damage

Saying build armor/play a tank will be downvoted.
But seriously... do that

I remember my first time new Poppy that happened at Aram. I was solo diving with Graves Ashe and Teemo focusing me and still managing to either kill one or take him under 30%hp. Enouph to win the teamfights. Or if i am to exxagerate like most of this thread i was killing all of them! SOLO!

I dont have problem admiting that ad are a bit stronger now(especially Corki is a major offender mostly due to mix damage). But a 4 ad comp is asking for problems. 

AP have great assasination options in the hands of Ahri and Leblanc and i am talking top picks here. You can add other in that pool like Fizz or Diana.

No Ad mid will come close to the utility of Ori or Lux. There is a reason why almost all the immigrant supports are from Mid. They have utility. Annie is actually a viable mid. 

Top has been mostly bruisers and tanks but lets not forget how many nerfs Lulu took for that (and as a support main i hate i cant play her to her full potential, she was the funniest support to play when released). Ryze is also a choise if you want to have someone with hyperscaling top. And you can protect him. Also Swain can shutdown melee tops better than adcs.

With the exception of Corki, AP dominate the siege game as mid . They are the backbone of any siege comp (mostly for their combination of waveclear, teamfighting and poke) along with a long range bit ADC. Varus comes behind the likes of Lux, Xerath. And no, Yasuo or Zed cant wave clear as safe. Even Victor have it better.

Better teamfight presence for AP mids. I dont think that needs to be explained.

Armor stacking is real. You need one AP champ because if frontline gets 3 armor items you are done for good. Bruisers that have Tabi, Titanic and one armor item can snowball the mid game due to the amount of physical damage they have and can take . Corki ofc is the offender here.

Zhonyans indeed has one of the best actives no matter what and it pays it heavily in price (check out how much Talisman gives for a mini Sivir ult). But it still can avoid a lot damage. Was Maw line a bit too good? Yeap but it got nerfed. Speaking of items, the overall dps of ad items was nerfed with the revamp and almost noone bothered to do the maths. Also i still consider Ludens a major offender. RoA is actually pretty good and is picked a lot.

I am not saying that AP is stronger than AD. Yeah they are a tad weaker. But saying that adcs dominate is a blatant lie. Ap still have options (and many like Anivia were not mentionedand) that was the point of all the above. Massively exaggerating does not lead anywhere.
Top sees a huge variety this season from pseudo adcs (Graves and Quinn) to bruisers, light fighters and tanks. Some ap also make appearance there mostly Lulu.
Ahri and Leblanc dominate mid(mobility and better late teamfight than their ad counterparts) but we also see other there like classic mages (lux surpassed zed in nerf topics), Corki (shrug) melee ad assasins and Cho "anti-assasin" Gath.
Jungle is curious. From farm junglers(yi/shy) to early gangers(elise lee vi) to massive frontliners.
Bot is boring. Morde seemed a hopeful attempt but yeah adc dominate there. I would love to see a couple healthy Morde-like champions to have variety. Supports are in the same boring state that i cba mentioning.
{{champion:44}} But I love 4 AD team comps...
I was gonna make a less detailed version of what you just posted. People would win so many more games if they were willing to play tanks.

Lets remember this: tanks are the only class that gets diminishing returns on stat purchases of Armor/Mr. and they dont get cheaper as you increase that diminishing return. meanwhile Pen items give increasing returns as a tank tries to get tankier. basically as Ive been saying since s3 Armor pen, particularly % armor pen and armor shred, have ruined this game for anyone that plays tanks. the only solution is to have a rough 150 armor after pen and back that up with a significant amount of health, but wait! %hp damage exists for some reason, some of it unmitigatable! "{{champion:67}} {{champion:114}} " basically, in this meta, if you arent playing a bruiser like, darius or Trundle, a fighter/assassin like yasuo, zed, kha'zix, or an AD like corki, ezreal, you are a fourth class citizen, with support being your backup frontliner half the time and your actual frontliner being a dead sponge after 4 seconds. congrats, you changed nothing!

And let's not forget that if you're one of the champs that gets their tankiness from items like {{item:3143}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3083}}  (like nearly every tank in the game), not only are you passing up on the damage that you could be building, but {{item:3036}} makes it so that you take 15% extra damage since marksmen don't build health.

What do you mean by "4 AD"? Because 4AD comps were always pretty common. An AD toplaner like Darius, Renekton, Jax or Gnar. An AD Mid like Zed, Jayce, or Varus. An AD Jungler like Lee, Reksai, Wukong, or Pantheon. Then an ADC. 

If you mean "4adc comps", well you have options. You can play tanks that do well against ADCs (Rammus, Malphite, Taric, Braum). You can play Assassins. You can play AoE mages who can burst out the entire team (Orianna, Lux). Xin, Yi, and Irelia can all splitpush well and 1v1 any ADC.
{{champion:54}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:44}} ............
If it's a problem you should at least try to explain why...

I specifically didn't explain why in the OP, because opening the discussion almost always gets more attention than stating your opinion. I've actually made statements on some posts in the comments before you posted this.
Although again, i specifically avoided stating why i thought it was a problem, or how to solve it.
